title: track current capability analysis (lp:#1838171)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1838171) created by **Oleg Endo (oleg.endo)**
```
When designing power distribution stuff, it's of course important to get an
overview of current capability of the traces.  We've got the pcb calculator
which is a nice supplementary tool to get some estimates.  However,
analysis of actual layout requires more work and has to be done manually.

It'd be really useful if there was a way to analyze a net and/or a
subsection/area of a net for current carrying capability.  Perhaps it's
difficult to get a perfect detailed analysis, but a rough estimate would
already be really helpful and speed up the design process.  Most of the
info is already available:
  - copper layer thickness
  - inner layers vs. outer layers
  - stitching via sizes (can use rough estimate for via current)

The max. desired temperature rise variable could be stored as a board
settings option or somehow entered in the UI for the analysis.
```

title: "select single track" and "select connected tracks" essentially the same (lp:#1838166)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1838166) created by **Oleg Endo (oleg.endo)**
```
Some time ago there was a clear difference of "select single track" in
pcbnew and "select connected tracks".  Usually "select single track" would
stop at T-like track junctions, but now both select methods are essentially
the same.

I guess it's also debatable what a "single track is" ... until the next via
or through the via?  Very often I'd like to select a "single track" only on
the currently active layer (e.g. don't crawls through the vias).
```

title: "list nets" dialog in pcbnew should be non-modal (lp:#1838162)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1838162) created by **Oleg Endo (oleg.endo)**
```
Right now the "list nets" dialog is modal.  If it's open, the pcb can't be
scrolled or dragged.  Clicking on a net in the dialog that is out of sight
will not do "fit to view" and also does not allow doing that manually by
zooming & scrolling the pcb.  So one has to close the dialog, guess where
the net was, move the pcb into place, open the dialog again, re-type the
filter string ....

It'd be much easier if the dialog was non-modal, like e.g. the DRC results
dialog.
```

title: Bus/hierarchy bug, netlist broken (lp:#1838140)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1838140) created by **Diego Herranz (diegoherranz)**
```
Hi, all.

I'm using nightlies and facing a weird bug with buses. I was wondering
whether it can be related to recent bus upgrades.

I've got a bus:
ROW0, ROW1, ROW2, ROW3, ROW4, ROW5, ROW6, ROW7, which on the PCB layout
becomes
ROW0, ROW0, ROW0, ROW0, ROW0, ROW0, ROW0, ROW7 ???
It seems to be semi-random and I've seen other combinations too.

I've managed to reduce the SCH to a minimal example (attached). Further
changes to this seem to fix it somehow, so I couldn't reduce it anymore.
Note that one of the symbols is not on the official library so I've
included a local library.
I've tried replacing that symbol for a standard header, but that seems to
fix the problem, although I can't see anything wrong with the symbol
itself.

I asked on the development mailing list and jp charras confirmed it:

> I confirm there is a serious issue shown by this sample: the netlist is
broken.
> Moreover, when I try to add a bus name ("ROW[0..7]") to the bus, Eeschema
crashes.
> Looks like the bug has something to do with hierarchical labels.

> I do not see issues with the schematic.

I agree it is a serious one too given it breaks the netlist. I've got a SCH
which I can't layout because of this. It's not an important project and
that is why I'm using nightlies, but now I can't open the layout on 5.x
stable because the format changed :)

Many thanks!
```

title: EESchema - <enter> or Find button attempts to advance to second hit (lp:#1838021)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1838021) created by **Art (diametrix)**
```
If I try to find a symbol in an existing schematic and type it's name in
the Find text box, that symbol reference field becomes highlighted but the
cursor doesn't move to the symbol.  That doesn't help me at all if the
symbol is off the screen or more frequently under the Find pop-up window.
Now if I hit the Find button I get the message about reaching the end of
the schematic and nothing being found.  Only if I hit Find button again
will it actually move the cursor to the symbol.

A couple of things here.  The cursor behavior in EESchema need to copy that
of PCBNew.  If I have both windows open and run a search in EESchema,
PCBNew actually behaves as you would expect it and pans and zooms on the
desired footprint and highlights it even before the Find button is pressed.
Second, Find pop-up dialog should never cover the results of the search.
It is a good feature to remember its last position, but the default
position should be somewhere else, rather than the center of the screen.
Better yet forget Win 3.11 style search and have a simple text box in the
the GUI panel along with the rest of the buttons and add an options drop
down list where you can tune parameters for your search.
```

title: PCBnew: Length Matching tool does not match to full length (lp:#1837913)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837913) created by **Madeliene Kattman (katm)**
```
Hi,

I'm laying out several DDR4 packages for an embedded design. I've recently
discovered the pad to die length feature, and this would dramatically
simplify my life, allowing me to keep track of package skews within kicad
(instead of a really complicated spread sheet).

After I add the skew value (in mm) to the FPGA package, it correctly
displays the trace segment lengths, the total PCB trace length, the Full
net length, and the pad to die length.

However, when I want to length match, it only matches to the PCB trace
length, not the full length (which includes PCB skew).

This means that I can't actually use kicad to length match with this new
feature, because I still need to keep track of the pad skews and arrive at
separate PCB trace lengths per byte lane.

I obviously need to length match to the full net length, not just the PCB
trace length.

Would it be possible to select which length I want to match - either the
PCB trace length or the full trace length (that includes package skew)?

I am currently using:
```

title: Paste-only pads do not adhere to paste shrinkage (lp:#1837808)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837808) created by **Evan Shultz (evan-shultz)**
```
I believe some time ago pads with only a paste layer were changed so that
they weren't affected by any paste shrinkage at the footprint level. I have
a vague memory of that on the dev mailing list but I can't find it now.

Anyway, I'm not convinced that this is always the desired behavior.

See https://www.infineon.com/cms/en/product/packages/PG-TISON/PG-
TISON-8-2/. On this footprint there are paste pads for each outer copper
pad which are derived from the outer copper pads with a -0.05mm paste
clearance. That clearance value can be put on the footprint to affect pins
1 and 5 through 8. But on the big copper shape for pins 2-4, there are also
paste pads. It may be fine to place paste-only pads the same size as the
outer copper pads and let them shrink with the footprint paste clearance
instead of making paste-only pads ignore the footprint paste clearance.

I can see paste-only pads adhering to the footprint paste clearance or not
being valuable. And both dialogs where paste clearance can be adjusted have
warning about this, which is nice.

My suggestion is to give flexibility to this behavior, perhaps by adding a
preference option, because in some cases the current behavior isn't the
easiest to use and most intuitive.

See the example footprint I'll add to the next comment. Here the footprint
has one copper pad at the top left, and two paste-only pads on the right.
The footprint has a negative paste clearance, but the paste-only pads don't
shrink at all. If an option to have paste-only pads use the footprint paste
clearance was added, then I would expect the right two pads to shrink.

Note that this applies to mask-only pads as well.
```

title: Improve zone and polygon edge modification (lp:#1837762)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837762) created by **Art (diametrix)**
```
The middle slider of each segment of a zone outline (the round one) is
really difficult to adjust while preserving alignment of the adjacent
segments.  For example: a simple case of rectangular zone outline - if it
has been drawn in one grid dimension and then the grid has been changed, an
attempt to move a side by its middle slider in one direction will lead to
it also snapping to the grid in the other direction, thus moving the corner
points and rendering the sides not perpendicular to each other.  Even with
Ctrl key modifier I don't get consistent results in making it move along
the axis.  Sometimes it does, sometimes I still end up with skewed sides.

I would suggest allowing those to move only in direction of the axes (i.e.
if you started to move along Y axis only that move is allowed until it is
released)  Ctrl modifier can be used to lock the move in the perpendicular
direction of the side being moved.  This would make aligning zones with
sides that are at an angle to the main axes.
```

title: Assign net classes in pad context menu (lp:#1837636)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837636) created by **Will Carroll (will.carroll7)**
```
The current procedure for assigning net classes to nets in Pcbnew is
tedious and time-consuming. In order to assign a net class one must open
the "Setup > Design Rules..." dialog and manually sort through the list of
nets to find the desired net, then use the ">>>" net class assignment
widget to assign the net to a net class. Additionally, the Design Rules
dialog disallows any interaction with the editor window while it is open --
requiring the user to repeatedly open and close the dialog.

I propose an enhancement by adding an option to the context menu of a pad
that allows the user to change the net class of the pad's associated net
either through a sub-menu of the new context menu option or through an
additional dialog activated by the new context menu option.


Related:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/kicad/+bug/1787220
This feature request discusses adding a net class reassignment option to
the context menu for a track or via, which was determined in that request
to be the wrong approach, as nets are not associated with tracks and vias,
but with pads.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/kicad/+bug/1749474
This feature request discusses improving the overall design language of
KiCad "to pass engineering notes from the schematic to the layout program".
This would probably involve a way to assign some type of net class
information within Eeschema. Because the only current way to assign net
classes is within Pcbnew through the Design Rules dialog, making this
process faster by adding it to the pad context menu seems logical.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/kicad/+bug/1822493:
This feature request discusses simplifying the net class assignment dialog
so that assigning net classes in bulk via the dialog is easier. It differs
from this request in that this request is proposing a method of reassigning
net classes without having to use the Design Rules dialog.
```

title: Junction added after deletion: end point on wire not "joined" (lp:#1837398)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837398) created by **Brian Piccioni (br0an)**
```
This just popped up and is 100% repeatable. If I move this block (I've
reduced the schematic to a 4 wires) a junction gets added on SDA and SCL.
It seems that there once were end points where the junctions show up.

If I delete the junctions, they are gone until I move the block then re-
appear as the end points are still there.

I only noticed the extra junctions by accident well after I had completed
the design and started layout after I made a cosmetic change to the board
by shifting the schematic a few mm. I would not normally have run error
checks after such a small change.

I think proper behavior would be for the mid wire end-points to be removed
when the junction is removed so junctions do not automatically re-appear at
a later date.

I can re-create the issue by making 4 wires cross, adding 4 junctions,
deleting 2 junctions, and moving the block.
```

```
In eeschema, cutting a block and then pasting it loses its annotations.

To reproduce:
1. Start a new project, open eeschema.
2. Place a resistor, value 1K, annotation R10.
3. Drag-select around the resistor, right-click and select Cut.
4. Right-click, select Paste, and click again to place the block.

Expected behavior: The annotations do not change.
Actual behavior: The annotations are lost (i.e. R10 is now R?)


This is a productivity hit, since moving blocks from one hierarchical sheet
to another loses
all annotations unexpectedly.
```

title: Footprint editor - problem copying and pasting footprints with certain names (lp:#1837221)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837221) created by **Art (diametrix)**
```
The footprints with shorter names seem to have no problems to be copied and
pasted again.  It creates a new one with the same name and "_copy" at the
end.  However with longer names, nothing happens.  No new footprint is
pasted.  For example, I couldn't duplicate a footprint named
"24-VQFN_4x4mm_Pitch0.5mm", which I believe a footprint from KiCad library.
Is it a character limit for footprint names issue?
```
Original tags: pcbnew

title: Footprint editor - Solder paste ratio clearance issues (lp:#1837220)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837220) created by **Art (diametrix)**
```
I was trying to enter solder paste clearance issues manually and was
getting puzzling results.  Definitely not the value I entered until I
realized that default value of ratio clearance wasn't zero.   So both of
those values were driving the actual clearance.  You need to zero out one
if another one is manually changed.

BTW,you are using ratio for clearance as a negative value.  By definition,
ratio can't be negative.  Its that pesky math thing.
```

title: Wishlist: Schematic copy paste offers options on how to deal with existing annotation (lp:#1837002)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1837002) created by **Rene Poeschl (poeschlr)**
```
Right now copy paste always resets the annotation. This is ok if one
intents to duplicate a section of the schematic. If one wants to move a
part of the schematic from one sheet to another then this is not really
helpful.

How about a feature similar to how word processors handle copying of text.
They ask if one wants to keep the original formatting, copy text only, ...
(With a small unintrusive toolbar right next to the mouse at paste, but it
can even be a small popup window in the beginning.)
```

title: pcbnew board setup dialog does not set values. (lp:#1836909)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836909) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
In Master branch:

Setting any value in board setup dialog has no effect: closing and re-
opening the dialog looses its previous content.

Opening board setup->tracks and vias there is no item in the table, even if
width and via sizes is defined and appears in the drop-down menu in the
main window of pcbnew.

The same happens using "edit predefined sizes" drop-down menu in the main
window toolbar.

Defining a new size and clicking 'ok' does not accept the value (it does
not update the list of usable track sizes).

To test it:
File->board setup
(all the tables are empty)
Change or set something (for instance the number of layers of the board)
close dialog with "ok"
The number of layer is not changed (no change in the layers panel).
Re-opening the File->board setup dialog still shows 2layers.

Also with a "clean build" i get the same behaviour.

Cheers,
Dino.

-----
```

title: A new EESchema -> PCBnew cross probbing issue (lp:#1836600)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836600) created by **Art (diametrix)**
```
If I select a symbol in EEschema it becomes highlighted in PCBNew. Now if I
switch into PCBNew and select a different footprint the previous one
remains selected in both PCBNew and EESchema.  If I click on the footprint
that remains selected again and then on another one it still remains
selected.  Clicking outside the board outline doesn't deselect it either.
The only way to deselect it is to hit ESC.

The logic behind highlighting the footprint is also unclear.  If I simply
click on a footprint in the PCBNew, that footprint becomes highlighted
without affecting any contrast settings, just like you would expect it.
Now if I select a symbol in the EESchema, you would expect the same
behavior, but instead everything become dark except for the selected symbol
(the same way it looks when you select "Highlight all copper items of a
net" )  And again, clicking outside the board outline doesn't quit this
weird mode or deselects the footprint.
```

title: ngspice subcircuits with parameters + netlabels, broken (lp:#1836502)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836502) created by **Jonatan Liljedahl (kymatica)**
```
Simulation breaks with subcircuits with parameters in 5.1.2, if the
subcircuit is connected to a named net. It’s the quotes around the net name
that breaks it:

XPOT1 Net-_POT1-Pad1_ “/pot_out” GND pot r=100k k=0.5

5.1.0 does not produce the quotes, and works as expected.

Error message is:

Circuit: KiCad schematic
Original line no.: 25, new internal line no.: 45:
Mismatch: 2 formal but 3 actual params.
R=OT;K=100K;
Original line no.: 25, new internal line no.: 45:
Undefined number [OT]
Original line no.: 25, new internal line no.: 45:
Formula() error.
R=OT;K=100K;
Original line no.: 0, new internal line no.: 9:
Undefined number [K]
Original line no.: 0, new internal line no.: 9:
Cannot compute substitute
Original line no.: 0, new internal line no.: 10:
Undefined number [K]
Original line no.: 0, new internal line no.: 10:
Cannot compute substitute
Copies=48 Evals=47 Placeholders=2 Symbols=2 Errors=7
Numparam expansion errors: Problem with input file.
Error: ngspice.dll cannot recover and awaits to be detached

For reference, here's the subcircuit:

.SUBCKT pot 1 2 3 r=100k k=0.5
*
R1 2 3 {r*(1-k)}
R2 1 2 {r*(k)}
.ENDS
```

title: Bold text cutoff in GTK (lp:#1836498)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836498) created by **Ian McInerney (imcinerney)**
```
In the confirmation dialog that asks about unsaved changes when you close
the window there is some text being cutoff. It appears to be related to the
use of wxRichMessageDialog, since it only effects libedit on Linux (every
other unsaved changes dialog uses the normal wxMessageDialog). See the
attached screenshot for an example. The text should have "closing?" visible
on the end, and also the lower extents of the lower row of text are cutoff
(e.g. the bottom of y, p, etc.).

I think this is more of a wx bug than a KiCad bug, but I don't know which
platforms it affects. Do any OSX devs see this in any of the dialogs? All
of the unsaved changes confirmation dialogs there use the rich message. Is
```

title: [eeschema][Linux] certain grid dots dissapearing after zoom or middle mouse drag (lp:#1836457)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836457) created by **Lada (sumis)**
```
Hello all,

I noticed an interesting behaviour of the grid dots in eeschema in version
5.1.2 on Linux (Fedora 30). The thing is that sometimes (but very often)
when I zoom/unzoom or drag ussing the middle mouse button, the "minor" grid
dots disappear and only the "big ones" remain. A left click or change of
zoom usually bring the missing dots back. Please see the attached short
screen capture documenting this.

Window version 5.1.2 does not exhibit this behaviour (tested on the same
computer via dualboot). Also Linux version 5.0.2 does not do this. I also
experimented with building using GTK+ 2 and 3, but this made no difference.
Running a custom build of 5.1.2 or Fedora's package doesn't make a
difference either. This suggests that this might be Linux (Fedora?) and 5.1
specific thing.

want me to.
```

```
We currently flip across X (like a flip-chart).

I'd like it to flip across Y (like pages of a book).
```

title: pcbnew and footprint editor: export selection as dxf (lp:#1836231)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836231) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
Introduction:
-The 2d drawing capabilities in kicad for lines are limited and creating
complex shapes is easier using a different 2D CAD (librecad, autocad
etc...) to create a dxf file and then import it in pcbnew or footprint
editor with file->import->graphics.
-A whole layer in pcbnew can be exported in dxf format using plot and
choosing dxf format, but this option is not available in the footprint
editor.


Wish:
It should be useful being able to select a group of 2D lines (as a board
outline or a component silk screen etc) and export just the selection
without the need to export the whole layer.

Typical usage case:
Create a 2D shape in an external CAD
Import in kicad
Modify it in kicad
At the change number 12345 you figure out that the next step would be much
easier using the librecad tool "xyz", but editing the original dxf file
implies re-doing the 12344 changes you made in kicad.
so [new feature]: Export the outline you need to change in dxf format
modify it in librecad (or autocad or any..cad)
re-import in kicad.


At least this wishlist can be reduced to "add dxf export or dxf plot to
footprint editor" (probably it would be easier/faster to implement)

Cheers,
Dino.
```
Original tags: dxf export feature.request pcbnew plot

title: Update footprint does not reset text visibilities (lp:#1836183)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836183) created by **Romain (romain145)**
```
In the "Update Footprints from Library" window (attached), when replacing a
footprint the visibility of the text on the F.Fab layer does not change
despite the box "Reset text layers and visibilities" being ticked.
I have made the Value field (on the F.Fab layer) invisible and saved the
footprint, but the change is not taken into account.

Expected behaviour: if the box "Reset text layers and visibilities" is
ticked, the visibility should be updated.
Actual behaviour: the visibility of the text is not updated.
Workaround: ticking the box "Reset text sizes, styles and positions" does
change the visibility and resets the position of all texts.
```

title: Default selected button in close confirmation dialogue is "Discard Changes" on GTK (lp:#1836178)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836178) created by **Alexander Willer (awiller)**
```
Affects all applications.

When switching the active footprint, symbol or closing the application
window while having unsaved changes, the appearing confirmation dialog has
"Discard Changes" selected as the default option.

"Cancel" or "Save Changes" should be the default selected option to prevent
data loss. In my opion, "Cancel" would be the better choice, since it
doesn't alter any data by accident (in contrast to "Save Changes".
```

title: Transparant images in page layout get dark background in PDF (lp:#1836173)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836173) created by **Seppe Stas (seppestas)**
```
When using transparant images in a page layout, the images gets a dark gray
background when exporting a sheet or a layout to PDF.

I think using images with a transparant backround makes sense because they
work on both a dark background like the layout editor and light backgrounds
like PDF exports and the default schematic editor color scheme.

The image is rendered correctly in the schematic and layout editors.

See attached images.
```

title: Symbol Editor - Can't edit arc radius (lp:#1836116)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1836116) created by **Seth Hillbrand (sethh)**
```
I just tried out the new arc tool in libedit and there's a lot to like.  It
is nice to be able to edit the end points directly.

However, I can't adjust the arc angle.  All arcs appear to draw at 180º.

I think it would be a good idea to unify the arc editors between libedit
and pcbnew/modedit.  In this case, drawing the initial arc as center ->
start -> end with a helper overlay would be good.  Then, when editing, use
the mid-point editor to allow making the arc shallower or deeper while
keeping the end points fixed.

Additionally, it would be good to include the arc parameters as editable
values in the arc properties window.

    BUILD_GITHUB_PLUGIN=ON
    KICAD_USE_OCE=ON
    KICAD_USE_OCC=OFF
```

```
Kicad uses the IPC convention of assigning diode cathodes as pin 1 and
anode as pin 2, while the spice simulation engine uses pin 1 as anode.
Although spice models are not included in (most of?) the kicad built-in
libraries, the system appears to recognize diodes and generate a default
spice diode element. The difference in the spice and kicad/IPC conventions
results in incorrect simulations without warning to the user. Additionally,
at no point during use is the user warned that the common diode symbols are
incompatible with the spice simulation feature.

While this is not strictly a bug in the software or mistake in the library,
the two combined results in a significant failure during actual use of the
spice simulation feature.
```

title: Cross ref in schematic text (lp:#1835921)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835921) created by **Hildo Guillardi Júnior (hildogjr)**
```
Seeing that KiCad is having a effort to update the text box behavior /
features, I propose a new one.
By some code as `\ref{ID_PART1}` the text will create a cross reference
(maybe in the future also hyperlink in the PDF centralizing the referenced
part) that will appear in the text as the reference of the part.

For example, the parts:
R1 -> ID_PART1
R2 -> ID_PART2
R3 -> ID_PART3

In the text:
`\ref{ID_PART1}` became 'R1'
`\ref{ID_PART1, ID_PART3}` became 'R1, R3'
`\ref{ID_PART1, ID_PART2, ID_PART3}` became 'R1-R2'

This will help to do documentations in the project that always have the
correct reference (example: "assemble \ref{ID_PART1} in case of..." will
never refer to a wrong component, if the parts are re-annotated).

To create a good user experience, the text input dialog (in Eeschema and
Pcbnew) could have a button "Add ref" that opens a list of components or
allow click in one to take the UNIQUE ID / TIME STAMP.

Also: the text boxes should be be update in Eschema always that the
"Annotate Schematic" run and in Pcbnew always that sync with Eschema. In
case of not present the ID anymore, the text could be "REF ERRO!".
```

title: Eeschema crashing extraordinarily frequently (lp:#1835907)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835907) created by **Ron Burkey (rburkey)**
```
Recently, eeschema has been spontaneously crashing very frequently.
Yesterday it crashed for me perhaps two dozen times.  I've not reported it
because I couldn't reproduce it. However, I found a reproducible case this
morning, using the current nightly.

What you see in the linked video
(https://drive.google.com/open?id=15YeV1E9CO4MgU8pfzFPE8cPrTKNE06Ce) is me
beginning a net-highlight operation, then deciding instead to do a place-
component operation.  (Notice that even though I click the place-component
button, eeschema still remains in net-highlight mode.)  I then click the
net-highlight button again, but eeschema (and kicad as well) crash.  This
seems to happen almost every time I try that particular combination of
operations, but there are other combinations (which I can't presently
identify) that have the same effect.

For what it's worth, here's a zipfile containing the schematic I am working
on in the video:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=10DCzQk6ShE6tyR7gv_M57SUXi1Ty3JEP.  The
video is of the top-level sheet, module.sch.  It may or may not be relevant
that this schematic has a bitmap image in the background template, which
I'm using to position objects during placement.  Another perhaps-novel
feature is that the sheet itself also has a small bitmap image (a logo)
that's not visible in the video.
```

title: pcbnew wishlist: "select until via(s)" and "select dangling" (lp:#1835789)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835789) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
When routing a board, often I need to select a part of a track that starts
from one via and ends at another via (i.e. to change layer or set width
etc).

A new right-click menu item (once a segment of the track has been selected)
like
Select->track between via(s)
just near the "select single track" and "select connected tracks"
that helps to select that part of the track should be useful.


Second selection-wish: Being able to select "dangling" tracks, with a new
item in the right-click pop-up menu  like

Select->Dangling track

So that if the segment selected belongs to a track that has one side not
connected to anything, it gets selected from the loose end to the first
bifurcation or via.
In the attached image an example of what I'd like to be able to select this
way.

Cheers, Dino.
```
